full_summary:
================================
# Annulment of Government Contract for Personal Body Armor

## Contract Information

* **Contract Title**: W8486-228411 / A
* **Reference No.**: PW-22-01005519
* **Amendment No.**: 8
* **Publication Date**: August 26, 2022
* **Tender Closes**: November 18, 2022 at 14:00:00 (Eastern Time)

## Contract Status

* **Tender Status**: Cancelled

## Contract Description

The contract notice for the procurement of personal body armor has been annulled by the Department of National Defence. The procurement method was competitive and open bidding, with a focus on the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

## Relevant Details

* **Procurement Category**: Goods
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions of Opportunity**: Canada
* **Regions of Delivery**: Quebec, excluding National Capital Region (NCR)

## Contracting Party

The contracting party is the Department of National Defence, located at 101 Colonel By Drive, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0K2, Canada.

## Contact Information

For any questions or concerns regarding this contract notice, please contact:

Lee, Adam
Email: [adam.lee@forces.gc.ca](mailto:adam.lee@forces.gc.ca)

Note: As the contract has been annulled, no further information or attachments are available.

I reformatted and revised the original text into a professional and concise contract notification. The rewritten entry still includes all the relevant details about the contract status, procurement method, and relevant information, but in a more organized and clear format. I used headings to separate the information and made sure to use proper terminology and formatting throughout the entry. I also reformatted the contact information and kept it concise and to the point. I made sure to keep the entry within the 400-word limit. Let me know if you need me to make any changes. 

Here is a breakdown of the changes I made:

* I reformatted the text into a clear and easy-to-read format.
* I used proper headings and subheadings to organize the information.
* I changed the formatting of the contract details to make it easier to read.
* I kept the relevant information the same, but condensed it into a more concise format.
* I removed unnecessary text and formatting options.
* I kept the entry to within
